Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cent \Cent\, n. [F. cent hundred, L. centum. See {Hundred}.] 1. A hundred; as, ten per cent, the proportion of ten parts in a hundred. [1913 Webster]
2. A United States coin, the hundredth part of a dollar, formerly made of copper, now of copper, tin, and zinc. [1913 Webster]
3. An old game at cards, supposed to be like piquet; -- so called because 100 points won the game. --Nares. [1913 Webster]
cent n 1: a fractional monetary unit of several countries 2: a coin worth one-hundredth of the value of the basic unit [syn: {penny}, {centime}]
